messages.message:
When selecting field type, due to not enable the table extraction, it greys it out in the drop down
Inside dark mode, its hard to see that there is actually another option available underneath the greyed out table extraction called list extraction nor that I can scroll too see more options

This was mainly an issue when running on default mac screen and there being limited space to show then AIHUB UI
cc: @Serena + @Natasha I experienced this earlier on as well but I've learned beyond it

What about sorting the disabled options to the bottom? Do we care about always maintaining the orders of the options?

Cc @danny.lan as well
I don't think order matters tbh as long it is consistent (order doesn't keep changing - which I know is not what you are suggesting :slightly_smiling_face:)

What I suggested would introduce some inconsistency though

Currently the options are ordered like so:
• text extraction
• List extraction
• Table extraction - could be disabled if table detection is off
• Document reasoning 
• Derived fields - could be disabled if field isn’t named yet
• Custom function fields - could be disabled if field isn’t named yet
If we sort the disabled options to the bottom, this will change the order

My preference is also for consistency of order, but I think we have this problem in general with dropdowns since scrollbars don’t always appear by default depending on browser/OS

Maybe we can add an opacity gradient to the bottom of the dropdown so it looks like there are more items? I think we have this design pattern elsewhere but I don’t remember exactly

ooh i like the opacity gradient idea! i think we’ve used opacity gradients in some places (ex: in an earlier version of the thumbnails in the document grid view, no longer shown in the current version though)

but i don’t think we’ve used opacity gradients for a scrollable element before - cc @Liam Callanan to confirm, or in case you have thoughts about this as a pattern?

We don’t use this pattern for any popups. I could try something like this but there’s a few caveats:
• the gradient needs to be large enough to reach content that isn’t just the bg color (since each option has padding) and small enough to not cover everything
• some popups allow custom content where scrolling is added outside of pollen within the popup, so I can’t easily detect scroll position.
adding a gif to illustrate the case where only “Text extraction” and “Table extraction” are visible

btw this component is just using `Select` from Pollen, so this isn’t a custom popup

i assumed we would just show the gradient at the bottom side of the select options, but i think this looks kinda weird if the options are actually enabled :disappointed: , although i didn’t play around with the `linear-gradient` very much to make it look nicer
